Monday, May 16, 2011 @ Brighton Music Hall
tUnE-yArDs with Buke and Gass, Pat Jordache
Doors at 8 PM; Show at 9 PM; 18+ show
Tickets - Advance Price $10

I love, loved tUnE-yArDs' first album, and the second, released this week, is being praised as one of the best of the year.  I would try to describe her music, but I'd do it badly.  It's different and amazing...give it a listen.  And the best part?  As good as the albums are, by all accounts they don't do justice to how good the music is performed live.  I know it's a Monday, but I promise it'll be worth your while.

We'll meet around 8:30 at the venue to grab a beer and socialize before the show.  Hope to see you there!

From allmusic:

tUnE-yArDs is the lo-fi experimental folk project of Merrill Garbus, also of the noisy indie pop band Sister Suvi. A truly solo project, Garbus began writing and performing under the tUnE-yArDs moniker in 2006. She assembled songs with a digital voice recorder and shareware mixing software, making a homespun patchwork of found sounds, field recordings, ukulele, unusual percussion, and her surprisingly soulful vocals. It took Garbus two years to piece her debut album, Bird-Brains, together, then she offered it as a pay-what-you-want download on the tUnE-yArDs website. Thanks to frequent touring with artists like Thao and positive buzz from music blogs, Garbus sold over $1,000 worth of copies of the album. In spring 2009, Marriage Records released the album on vinyl; that summer 4AD reissued it in a special screen-printed version limited to 1,000 copies before releasing a widely distributed CD version of Bird-Brains that fall, coinciding with a tour opening for the Dirty Projectors. For 2011's W H O K I L L, Garbus added bassist Nate Brenner to the fold and ventured into a professional studio for a more polished but still wide-ranging sound.
